com.bham.bd.audio

Class SequentialAudioPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bham.bd.audio.SequentialAudioPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AudioPlayer

    class SequentialAudioPlayer
extends Object
implements AudioPlayer

    Sequential Audio Player

    Used to play multiple tracks in sequence. Tracks are played one by one from start to finish in a sequence they were constructed from. The player resets itself after all tracks finish playing to the first track but does not start paying again.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private MediaPlayer currentTrack
      The current media player that is being played as per sequence order
      private boolean isPlaying
      Indicates whether this audio player is playing
      private ObjectProperty<Runnable> ON_END
      On end property indicating what method will be run after all tracks finish playing
      private ArrayList<MediaPlayer> PLAYERS
      List of media players that are played in sequence

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(double volume)
        Description copied from interface: AudioPlayer
        Sets volume for player(-s)

        Note: we don't need to assert the volume is within range [0, 1] because AudioManager will ensure it is withing those bounds. Even if not, MediaPlayer.clamp(double, double, double) ensures the proper range.

        Specified by:
        setVolume in interface AudioPlayer
        Parameters:
        volume - value between 0 and 1 indicating new volume
